intro: Raphanus strictus, commonly known as the narrowleaf radish, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other cruciferous plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, upright stems and narrow, elongated leaves. Its small white or purple flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in the spring. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
